text: Jane Hooper-Perroud (also known as Jane Hooper Perroud) is a Canadian curler from Bradford, Ontario. She is a and . ==Teams and events== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Coach ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 1995–96 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || Lisa Savage || || |- ! scope="row"| 1996–97 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || Lisa Savage || Mary Gellard || (8th) |- ! scope="row"| 1997–98 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || || || COCT 1997 (6th) |- ! scope="row"| 2013–14 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kathy Chittley-Young || Colleen Madonia || Jane Hooper- Perroud || || || CSCC 2014 |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Colleen Madonia || Karri-Lee Grant || Christine Loube || Jane Hooper-Perroud || ||Larry Snow || CSCC 2018 |- ! scope="row"| 2018–19 | Sherry Middaugh || Karri-Lee Grant || Christine Loube || Jane Hooper-Perroud || Colleen Madonia || Larry Snow || CSCC 2019 |} ==Private life== Hooper-Perroud is married to fellow curler Canadian curler Pat Perroud, who won Canadian and World championships with Al Hackner () and Ed Werenich ().Curling, Etcetera: A Whole Bunch of Stuff About the Roaring Game | Google Books (p. 58) ==References== ==External links== * * *Jane Hooper Perroud – Curling Canada Stats Archive *Jane Hooper-Perroud Pictures | Getty Images *A story of resilience at the 2019 Everest Senior Curling Championships | Curling Canada Category:Living people Category:Canadian women curlers Category:Curlers from Ontario Category:World curling champions Category:Canadian women's curling champions Category:People from Simcoe County Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
